instructions.name: Prepare the water
instructions.description: Fill a large and tall pot with natural water and put a lid on (to make water boil faster). If you want to reduce the time you can use hot water.

instructions.name: Boil the water
instructions.description: Place the pot on the stove over high heat.

instructions.name: Cook the pasta
instructions.description: When the water begins to boil, remove the lid and throw in a few sizeable pinches of coarse salt. Let it dissolve before adding your pasta. DO NOT COVER the pot with the lid anymore.

instructions.name: Stir the pasta
instructions.description: Stir frequently your pasta with a long spoon during the first minutes to prevent it from sticking. Then stir it occasionally till the end of the cooking process.

instructions.name: Drain the pasta
instructions.description: When your pasta is ready (check every now and then), drain it into a colander. Remember that 'al dente pasta' is still hard in the centre. DO NOT RINSE your pasta under running water.

instructions.name: Dress the pasta
instructions.description: Toss your pasta in a pan with the sauce you like and stir to combine all the ingredients.

instructions.name: Mix the ingredients
instructions.description: In a large bowl (or in an electric mixer) combine self-rising flour, yogurt and a generous pinch of salt.

instructions.name: Knead the dough
instructions.description: Knead until you have a smooth dough.

instructions.name: Cut the dough into circles
instructions.description: Put some flour on your clean work surface and stretch the dough using a rolling pin. Then cut the dough into circles.

instructions.name: Prepare the circles
instructions.description: Put these circles on a large baking sheet covered with baking paper.

instructions.name: Dress the circles
instructions.description: Put on each circle a light layer of tomato puree and some pieces of mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with oregano and add a drop of olive oil.

instructions.name: Bake
instructions.description: Bake for about 15 minutes (exact cooking time depends on your oven) at 200Â°.

instructions.name: Prepare the butter
instructions.description: Let butter soften at room temperature.

instructions.name: Chop the amaretti
instructions.description: Coarsely chop the amaretti cookies and set aside.

instructions.name: Break the biscuits
instructions.description: Break the biscuits into small pieces, but do not powder them (you can use a rolling pin, the back of a spoon or a meat tenderizer). Set aside.

instructions.name: Prepare the dough
instructions.description: In a large bowl, put the eggs with the sugar.

instructions.name: Beat the eggs
instructions.description: Beat them with an electric whisk until they turn pale yellow and foamy. Then add the softened butter.

instructions.name: Whisk
instructions.description: Whisk for a few seconds.

instructions.name: Add the cocoa
instructions.description: Sift the unsweetened cocoa powder through a fine mesh colander in order to get rid of any lumps.

instructions.name: Add the amaretti
instructions.description: Add the amaretti cookies coarsely crushed.

instructions.name: Mix all
instructions.description: Mix well with a spoon to combine all the ingredients.

instructions.name: Add the biscuits
instructions.description: Gradually add the biscuits and work until all the crumbs are completely coated with the chocolate mixture.

instructions.name: Shape the mixture
instructions.description: Shape this mixture into a log.

instructions.name: Wrap the mixture
instructions.description: Wrap it in a cling film or baking paper.

instructions.name: Cool down the mixture and serve
instructions.description: Put it in the fridge for a couple of hours, then cut the chocolate salami into slices and serve. (You can also freeze it).

instructions.name: Warm the milk
instructions.description: Warm the milk in a small saucepan or in the microwave. Cover and set aside.

instructions.name: Melt the butter
instructions.description: Place the butter in another saucepan and melt it completely over medium heat. Make sure it does not brown.

instructions.name: Whisk the flour
instructions.description: Add the sifted flour and continue whisking for 2/3 minutes until the butter-flour mixture turns to a golden colour.

instructions.name: Pour in milk
instructions.description: Gradually pour in the warm milk (a little at a time).

instructions.name: Whisk the sauce
instructions.description: Keep whisking for a few minutes so that no lumps form and your bechamel sauce is creamy.

instructions.name: Season
instructions.description: Then season with salt and nutmeg. Stir again

instructions.name: Stir
instructions.description: Stir again. Your bechamel sauce is ready.
